steps.title: Hold the lighter in your dominant hand with your thumb on the lid.
steps.content: Hold the lighter in your dominant hand with your thumb on the lid. Your index finger should be wrapped around the Zippo while your middle finger helps support the base of the lighter. Place your thumb on the top of the lighter and make sure that the lighter is secure in your hand.

steps.title: Press down on the lid of the lighter with your thumb.
steps.content: Press down on the lid of the lighter with your thumb. Create tension with your thumb by pushing down on the lid of the lighter. At the same time, you should be pushing up with your middle finger on the base of your Zippo. Your index finger will help keep the lighter in place.

steps.title: Slide your thumb across the front of the lid.
steps.content: Slide your thumb across the front of the lid. Once you've built up enough pressure, sliding your thumb across the front side of the Zippo lid should cause the lid to spring open. If you can't get it to work the first time, keep practicing and make sure that there is enough tension being created to open the lid.

steps.title: Light your Zippo.
steps.content: Light your Zippo. Use your thumb to strike the flint wheel on your lighter once it's open. You can now light whatever you need to.

steps.title: Close the lid by pushing it with your index finger.
steps.content: Close the lid by pushing it with your index finger. Once you're done using the lighter, you can close the lid with your other hand, or use your index finger to close it with one hand. Continue to practice until you can get the lid to pop open on the first try. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Hold the lighter in between your middle finger, index finger, and thumb.
steps.content: Hold the lighter in between your middle finger, index finger, and thumb. Use your index and middle fingers to press down on the top of the Zippo while your thumb presses up on the bottom of the lighter. Your hand will look like a claw while you hold the lighter. Make sure that your index and middle finger touch.

steps.title: Squeeze down with your index and middle fingers.
steps.content: Squeeze down with your index and middle fingers. Squeeze tightly and slide your index and middle fingers down the side of the lighter. If you do this hard enough, it should pop the lid. [2] X Research source You need to create enough pressure on the lid of the lighter so that it pops open.

steps.title: Slide your thumb on the side of the lighter.
steps.content: Slide your thumb on the side of the lighter. As the lid opens and your index and middle fingers slide down from the lid to the body of the lighter, your thumb will also have to slide across to the other side of the lighter. This small movement will ensure that you have control over the lighter. While the trick is simple to do, it may take several tries until your lid finally pops open.

steps.title: Hold the lighter in between your pinky and ring finger.
steps.content: Hold the lighter in between your pinky and ring finger. Place the Zippo in between your pinky and ring finger. The rest of your fingers should be bent. The top of the Zippo will pop out slightly above the top of your fingers.

steps.title: Roll the lighter over your ring finger.
steps.content: Roll the lighter over your ring finger. Use your middle finger to push the top of the lighter down while removing the tension in between your ring and pinky fingers. This will cause the lighter to roll over your ring finger and end up in between your ring and middle finger.

steps.title: Use your index finger to roll the lighter over your ring finger.
steps.content: Use your index finger to roll the lighter over your ring finger. Do the same motion that you did with the previous finger, but this time with your index finger. This will cause the lighter to roll over your middle finger and land in between your middle finger and index finger.

steps.title: Use your thumb to open the lid and light the wick.
steps.content: Use your thumb to open the lid and light the wick. Once your lighter is in between your index and middle fingers, you can use your thumb to press up on the lid and open the lighter. Then, use your thumb to strike the flint wheel to light the Zippo.

steps.title: Snap your wrist to close the lid of the Zippo.
steps.content: Snap your wrist to close the lid of the Zippo. Once you're done using the lighter, use a strong downward flicking motion to snap the lid of the Zippo closed. This should extinguish the flame.

steps.title: Roll the lighter backward across your other fingers.
steps.content: Roll the lighter backward across your other fingers. Once the lighter is closed, you can safely roll it back across your fingers, but this time in the opposite direction. Use the same method to roll the lighter back, but this time use your ring finger to do so. Once you become proficient with quickly rolling the lighter back and forth, you can incorporate it into other aspects of your Zippo lighter trick routine.

steps.title: Hold your thumb and index finger on the lid.
steps.content: Hold your thumb and index finger on the lid. Hold the Zippo right side up with your thumb and index fingers on both sides of the lid. [3] X Research source The rest of the lighter should be in front of your palm, and the lid should be facing upwards.

steps.title: Press down on the case with your pinky finger.
steps.content: Press down on the case with your pinky finger. As you press down with your pinky finger on the case, you'll want to lift up with your middle and index finger. This should begin to open the case.

steps.title: Rotate your wrist as the lid opens.
steps.content: Rotate your wrist as the lid opens. Rotate your wrist as the lid opens so that the bottom of the lighter can rest in your palm, while your index and thumb continue to hold the lid. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Ignite the lighter with your ring finger as the case opens.
steps.content: Ignite the lighter with your ring finger as the case opens. Immediately after opening the lid on the lighter, strike the flint wheel in one motion with your ring finger. If you do all the steps quickly in succession, it will look like you flawlessly lit your Zippo using one hand, in one motion.

steps.title: Hold the Zippo in between your index finger and thumb.
steps.content: Hold the Zippo in between your index finger and thumb. Put the lighter upside down, with the lid facing downwards. Your index and middle finger should be extended out, to look like a gun. The lighter should be nestled near the top of your palm.

steps.title: Flick your wrist upward to open the lighter.
steps.content: Flick your wrist upward to open the lighter. With the Zippo tightly secured between your fingers, quickly flick your wrist upward. This motion should open the lighter, with the flint wheel facing upwards. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Slide the palm of your other hand across the wheel.
steps.content: Slide the palm of your other hand across the wheel. Quickly strike your palm over the flint wheel towards you, to light the wick on your Zippo. This movement will replicate pulling back the hammer on a revolver, hence the name of the trick, "The Gun." Light whatever you need to with the flame.

steps.title: Snap your wrist downward to close the lighter.
steps.content: Snap your wrist downward to close the lighter. Making a quick downward motion with your hand will close the lighter and extinguish the flame. You've successfully pulled off the trick. [6] X Research source
